content.description: Start two feet right of Cutting Glass V0 with your left hand on a rounded nub and right hand in a shallow dish, both holds are located on a slopey rail. Traverse right up the rail to a dirty top out. The holds on the traverse are small but a kneebar helps with holding yourself on the rock.
content.location: Start two feet right of the obvious holds of Cutting Glass.

content.description:
Start on the obvious quartz hold with really good feet. Make long (crux) move up with you right hand to a sharp crystal. Reach around the arete to a good crimp and work feet up and move up using progressive better holds to the casual top out. 

  This route is sharp, a little crumbly at the starting feet and the top could use a good cleaning. Once the cleaning is done it could get another star.
content.protection: Pad to cover the very old stump near the base. spotters are also never a bad idea.
content.location: The left arete of the face, it starts on obvious quartz jugs.

content.description: A small boulder that has been largely neglected since the routes were first climbed on it and in use of a scrubbing. The potential for a couple more routes exist.
